topic.title: Internal Loopback Command

body.p: The Internal Loopback Command provides the control to internally loop of a port. There are two sub-commands, which are Get Internal Loopback and Set Internal Loopback. These sub-commands share a set of MRPC Command Return Values as summarized in:

Note that this MRPC command works on x2 physical port basis, for a physical port whose bifurcation is greater than 2, host can send MRPC command to operate every x2 port separately. This provides a smaller granularity of control. E.g. For a x8 physical port 32 (bifurcation 8 and Port ID 32), host can send command to operate every x2 port 32, 34, 36 or 38 separately.

table.title: MRPC Internal Loopback Command Return Values

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Internal Loopback - Get Internal Loopback Sub-Command

body.p: The Get Internal Loopback sub-command is used to determine if the internal loopback is enabled or disabled on a port.

table.title: Internal Loopback Command Get Internal Loopback Input Data

body.p: Specifies the Internal Loopback Sub-Command. Set to 0x0 for the Get Internal Loopback operation.
Port ID to read internal loopback is enabled or disabled .

table.title: Internal Loopback Command Get Internal Loopback Output Data

body.p: Port ID for reading if internal loopback is enabled or disabled on the port.
This return data of this field indicate if internal loopback is enabled or disabled:

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Internal Loopback - Set Internal Loopback Sub-Command

body.p: The Set Internal Loopback sub-command is used to internally loop the of a port.

table.title: Internal Loopback Command Set Internal Loopback Input Data

body.p: Specifies the Internal Loopback Sub-Command. Set to 0x1 for the Set Internal Loopback operation.
Port ID to setup internal loopback on a port .
This field specifies the control to enable or disable internal loopback :

2: Data-path Loopback, When this mode is selected, the port in loopback will be in link up status, customers can transmit TLPs to this port with another MRPC command TLP Injection Command, When the TLPs are looped back from the egress side to the ingress side, they will behave just like they are forwarded from external device that is connected to current port.
There is no output data for this sub-command.
